claim: People in middle school usually get breast exams.

supporting.text: Breast exams are typically recommended for adult women, not middle school students.

attacks.text: Breast exams are typically recommended for adult women, not middle school students.
Some middle school students may require breast exams due to early onset of puberty or medical conditions.
Early onset of puberty is rare, and routine breast exams are not standard practice for middle school students.
Breast exams can be part of health education in middle schools to promote awareness.
Health education in middle schools typically focuses on general wellness, not clinical breast exams.

supporting.text: Medical guidelines do not include routine breast exams for middle school-aged children.

attacks.text: Medical guidelines do not include routine breast exams for middle school-aged children.
Some middle school students may receive breast exams if they have a family history of breast cancer or other risk factors.
Such cases are exceptions and do not represent the general practice for middle school students.
Medical guidelines are not always strictly followed, and some healthcare providers may perform breast exams on middle school students.
Deviations from guidelines are rare and not representative of standard practice.

supporting.text: Middle school students are generally pre-pubescent or early pubescent, making breast exams unnecessary.

attacks.text: Middle school students are generally pre-pubescent or early pubescent, making breast exams unnecessary.
Some middle school students, especially older ones, may already be in mid-to-late puberty where breast exams could be relevant.
Even in mid-to-late puberty, breast exams are not standard practice for middle schoolers unless there are specific risk factors or symptoms.
Early detection of breast abnormalities is important regardless of age, so breast exams could be beneficial even for pre-pubescent students.
The likelihood of breast abnormalities in pre-pubescent students is extremely low, making routine exams unnecessary and potentially distressing.

supporting.text: Schools and pediatricians focus on general health screenings, not specialized exams like breast exams for this age group.

attacks.text: Schools and pediatricians focus on general health screenings, not specialized exams like breast exams for this age group.
Some middle schools in certain regions or with specific health programs may include breast exams as part of comprehensive health education.
Even in regions with comprehensive health programs, breast exams for middle schoolers are rare and typically require parental consent, making them uncommon.
Pediatricians sometimes perform breast exams if there are specific concerns or family history of breast cancer, even for middle schoolers.
Such cases are exceptions and do not represent usual practice, as most middle schoolers do not undergo breast exams without medical indication.
